condition.narrative: The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association for its review and approval, a Contingency Emergency Response Manual(“CER Manual”) which shall set forth detailed implementation arrangements for the Emergency Response Part of the Project. (Schedule2, Section I.D.1 of the FA)

The Recipient shall undertake no activities under the Emergency Response Part of the Project unless: (a) the Recipient hasdetermined that an Eligible Crisis or Emergency has occurred, has furnished to the Association a request to include said activitiesand the Association has agreed; and (b) the Recipient has ensured the preparation and disclosure of all environmental and socialinstruments as may be required for said activities, the Association has approved all said instruments, and the Recipient hasensured the implementation of any actions which are required to be taken under said instruments. (Schedule 2, Section I.D.3 of theFA)

The Recipient shall, throughout the implementation of the Emergency Response Part of the Project, maintain the institutionalstructures and arrangements established in accordance with the CER Manual, with adequate staff and resources satisfactory to theAssociation. (Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 of the FA)

The Recipient shall: (a) ensure that OPM is maintained with technical functions, staffing, and responsibilities satisfactory tothe Association, as set forth in the Project Operational Manual;(b) through OPM, maintain, throughout Project implementation, aProject Implementation Unit (PIU), with functions and responsibilities and composition acceptable to the Association, includingfiduciary functions, and staffing (including, inter alia, a Project manager, a procurement specialist and a financial managementspecialist), all as set forth in the Project Operational Manual; and,(c) No later than thirty (30) calendar days from theEffective Date, the Recipient, through OPM, shall hire the following additional PIU staff: (i) an environmental and socialspecialist (ii) an air transport and civil aviation specialist, and (iii) an airport planning consultant; all under terms ofreference, qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 of the FA)(d) No later thanthirty (30) days after the Effective Date, enter into an implementation agreement with DASPA, under terms and conditions acceptableto the Association (“Implementation Agreement”), which shall include, inter alia, (a) the roles and responsibilities of DASPA withregard to the implementation of said Part of the Project; and (b) the obligation of DASPA to comply with the requirementsapplicable to said Part of the Project in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.4 (a) ofthe FA)(e) No later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, the Recipient, through OPM, shall update the ProjectOperational Manual in a manner satisfactory to the Association and thereafter adopt said manual. (Schedule 2, Section I.B.2 of theFA)

The Recipient, through OPM, shall, no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter operate andmaintain throughout Project implementation, a steering committee (the Steering Committee) responsible for Project coordination andadvice on implementation constraints and policy-related concerns, with a composition and terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation, as further described in the Project Operational Manual. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 of the FA)
The Recipient, through the OPM, shall carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions of Article V of the GeneralConditions and Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement.

title.narrative: Regional change in airspace area covered by globally standardized air traffic monitoring system
Daily availability of DCF for safe emergency aircraft operations
Regional capacity building program on air traffic control and management prepared and endorsed

Percentage of Government staff trained on climate/disaster resilience

Change in number of women hired for middle-skilled jobs by DASPA

Revised Airport Master Plan available to support Government decision on Airport Investment
Completion of the study for the feasibility and installation of an ILS for DOM airport
